title.rendered: Reasons to  Move to Midtown East, NYC

content.rendered:
There’s no place like the Big Apple! New York City is the perfect city to move to as a young person, just ask any native New Yorker! So, how do you choose between which of the five boroughs to live in and what neighborhood to settle down in? There are numerous reasons as to why each borough is unique, however, if you choose to live in Manhattan, consider moving to the neighborhood of Midtown East.

Midtown East is located in NYC’s commercial epicenter. It’s always bustling and it truly encompasses the phrase, “the city that never sleeps”! Midtown East is located between 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue. From luxury buildings to numerous attractions, there’s always something to see and do in Midtown East. Here are a few reasons why Midtown East should be the place you move to in NYC!

Related : How To Find Cheap Apartments in New York? Manhattan Edition!

Spot famous landmarks

Nestled along the East River, Midtown East is a classic place to visit for tourists. Located right next to Grand Central Station, this neighborhood is what commuters from the tri-state area first see when they arrive in NYC.

In Midtown East, you’ll find numerous famous buildings such as the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, and the MetLife Building. Not to mention, the infamous Central Park is located here!

Shop at your favorite stores

Furthermore, Midtown East is the place to be for a shopaholic in NYC! From Fifth Avenue to Bryant Park, there are plenty of shopper’s favorite stores such as Zara and Urban Outfitters. There are also higher-end stores located here such as Bloomingdales.

Not to mention Midtown East is just a short 10-minute walk away from the Upper East Side, where you’ll find endless high-end stores and fashion designers. If you’re a fashion lover, take a short trip to the Upper East Side and shop to your heart’s content!

Eat and drink at delicious restaurants and bars

Midtown East has no shortage of restaurants serving delicious dishes. If you’re looking for a high-end restaurant in NYC, check out the fantastic French spot, La Grenouille, located at 3 E 52nd St. Or, if you’re looking for some fun American fare, check out P.J. Clarke’s, located at 915 3rd Ave. You’re bound to find your go-to spot for grub in Midtown East!

Besides, there’s plenty of hip bars in this bustling NYC neighborhood. If you’re looking for a reasonably priced American bar, check out Hudson Malone located at 218 E 53rd St. This spot offers beer, cocktails, and a classic American fare menu.

Visit historic museums

If you’re looking for a fun activity to do on the weekends in NYC, check out the museums and attractions that Midtown East has to offer. If you’re looking for a classic museum to visit, The Museum of Modern Art is a great place. Click here to see what exhibits are on display at The Museum of Modern Art!

However, if you want something a bit different, check out The Morgan Library and Museum. The Morgan Library and Museum is J.P. Morgan’s personal library, filled with books, manuscripts, drawings, paintings, and artifacts. Click here to learn more about the history of The Morgan!

Need some more Roomi in your life? Have your pick from Roomi’s endless recommendations crafted to your needs. Doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a room to call home, a couch to call your bed or a mate to share these with! Download the app here — and get surfin’
